intro: Tricostularia davisii, commonly known as the Davis's tricostularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three leaflets, and its small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to those of other members of its family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
